title: The Rise of Agentic Commerce: What CTOs Need to Know
excerpt: How AI agents are transforming B2B commerce and what it means for payment infrastructure.
body:
## The Agentic Future

AI agents are moving from assistants to autonomous actors in commerce. This shift has profound implications for how we build payment and commerce infrastructure.

## What Changes?

### Authentication

Agents need their own identity layer:
- Machine-to-machine auth
- Delegated authority models
- Audit trails for agent actions

### Authorization

New questions emerge:
- What can an agent buy?
- What are the spending limits?
- Who approves exceptions?

### Transaction Patterns

Expect:
- Higher volume, smaller transactions
- More complex multi-party flows
- Real-time negotiation

## Building for Agents

### API-First Design

Your APIs should be:
- Fully programmatic (no human-dependent flows)
- Rich in metadata
- Self-describing

### Guardrails

Build in:
- Configurable limits
- Approval workflows
- Kill switches

## Conclusion

The shift to agentic commerce is coming. Start building the infrastructure now.
